sentence: “I’m not aware of what his intention is.” Rep. Rodney Davis (R-Ill.), the party’s top member on the committee with jurisdiction over Capitol security, said: “Look, it’s gonna depend upon what Leader McCarthy wants.” Davis was one of McCarthy’s picks to sit on the select committee before he decided to boycott the panel over Pelosi’s refusal to seat two other Republican selections — Banks and Rep. Jim Jordan (R-Ohio).
title: The GOP’s Jan. 6 committee dilemma: Disband it, or turn it on Dems?

sentence: “I don’t know anything about what Madison referenced,” said Rep. Jim Jordan (R-OH), a leader of the right-most flank of the conference that includes Cawthorn.
author: Sam Brodey
title: Angry GOP Responds to Cawthorn’s ‘Bizarre’ D.C. Orgy Claims: ‘Name Names’

sentence: Cover-up specialist Rep. Jim Jordan (R-OH) refused to defend Cawthorn’s alleged sexcapades, telling The Daily Beast that he doesn’t “know anything about what Madison referenced” Even the perennial front runner for dumbest Congressman, Texas Republican Louis Gohmert called the North Carolina freshman’s remarks “bizarre.” Cawthorn is facing pressure from all sides now, inside and outside the party.
author: Ty Ross
title: WHODUNNIT? GOP clamors for names in Cawthorn “Orgy-gate” accusations
